org.youscope.common.image

Class ImageEvent<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.youscope.common.image.ImageEvent<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Specifies the array type of the image. Typically either byte[], short[], or int[].
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class ImageEvent<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Objects of this class contain the pixel data of an image, as well as metadata about it, like where and when an image was made.
    Author:
    Moritz Lang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getImageDataArrayType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getImageDataArrayType()
        Returns the class of the array in which the image data is stored. One of byte[].class, short[].class or int[].class.
        Returns:
        Class of array of image data.

      • getImageDataType

        public java.lang.Class<?> getImageDataType()
        Returns the class of the primitive type in which one pixel of the image data is stored. One of byte.class, short.class or int.class.
        Returns:
        Primitive class of image data.

      • createImage

        public static <T> ImageEvent<T> createImage(T imageData,
                                            int width,
                                            int height,
                                            int bitDepth)
                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new image with the given image data and meta information. The image data must be an array of primitive types byte, short or int. This limitation may change in future releases of YouScope.
        Parameters:
        imageData - Array of bytes, shorts or ints representing the pixel intensities, either of grayscale images or of several bands (colors) or color images.
        width - The width of the image in pixels.
        height - The height of the image in pixels.
        bitDepth - The bit depth of the image.
        Returns:
        Newly created image.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if imageData is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if type of image data is not supported by YouScope, or if number of pixels in imageData is not in agreement of claimed width and height of the image.

      • createImage

        public static <T> ImageEvent<T> createImage(T imageData,
                                            int width,
                                            int height)
                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new image with the given image data and meta information. The bit depth is set to the maximal bit depth for the given pixel type, i.e. 8bit for bytes, 16bit for shorts, and 32bit for ints.
        Parameters:
        imageData - Array of bytes, shorts or ints representing the pixel intensities, either of grayscale images or of several bands (colors) or color images.
        width - The width of the image in pixels.
        height - The height of the image in pixels.
        Returns:
        Newly created image.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Thrown if imageData is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if type of image data is not supported by YouScope, or if number of pixels in imageData is not in agreement of claimed width and height of the image.

      • setTransposeX

        public void setTransposeX(boolean transpose)
        Sets if the x-direction of images made by this camera should be transposed.
        Parameters:
        transpose - True, if the x-direction should be transposed.

        public void setTransposeY(boolean transpose)

        Parameters:

      • getImageData

        public T getImageData()
        Returns the pixel data as an array of primitive types (typically byte or short). Note that the pixel values are typically unsigned, whereas typical java operations on them assume them to be signed. This typically implies that one has to upcast them, e.g. byte to short, or short to int.
        Returns:
        the imageData

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns image width in pixels.
        Returns:
        image width in pixels.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns image height in pixels.
        Returns:
        image height in pixels

      • getBytesPerPixel

        public int getBytesPerPixel()
        Returns the number of bytes used to store each pixel. Typically one or two for grayscale images, and more only for colour images.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes used to store a pixel.

      • getBitDepth

        public int getBitDepth()
        Returns the bit dept. This has to be smaller or equal to getBytesPerPixel()*8. For example, 12bit/pixel images are typically stored in 2 bytes/pixel, which would allow for up to 16bit depth. However, 12bit pixels typically only use the lower 12bit of the 16bit available in two bytes.
        Returns:
        the bitDepth of the image.

      • getMaxIntensity

        public long getMaxIntensity()
        Returns the maximal intensity a pixel can have. This intensity is equal to 2^(getBitDepth())-1. Note that getImageData() returns unsigned values.
        Returns:
        Maximal pixel intensity.

      • setExecutionInformation

        public void setExecutionInformation(ExecutionInformation executionInformation)
        Sets the information of how often the image producing job was already executed when producing the image.
        Parameters:
        executionInformation - Information about producing job's evaluation times, or null.

      • getExecutionInformation

        public ExecutionInformation getExecutionInformation()
        Returns the information of how often the image producing job was already executed when producing the image.
        Returns:

        public void setCreationTime(long creationTime)

        Parameters:

        public void setChannelGroup(java.lang.String channelGroup)
